articles.title: US inflation is surging and rates will rise in March, so how long can the RBA hold fire here? - ABC News
articles.description: Despite surging inflation in the US and elsewhere overseas, the Reserve Bank of Australia thinks it has more time to wait before raising interest rates. But perhaps not as much time as some recent mortgage borrowers were counting on, writes Michael Janda.
articles.content:

articles.title: Concerns over when cruise industry will restart as safety protocols debated - 9News
articles.description: Greg Hunt said today the federal government has worked with the states to resume cruising in Australia, but the responsibility will lie with the individual state to "ensure they are ready".
